text.title: part6_Andrea Muizelaar on fashion, anorexia, and life after 'Top Model'

p.s: When your health faltered , that 's when you said , " No , I ca n't do this anymore
Correct .
This as well as the fact that the industry was cold and treating me quite badly .
Do you feel that there should have been more of a fine line drawn between the money you received , between " prize " and " work , " for tax purposes ?
Yes !
The money was at one point on the show classified as a prize and we never even thought about taxes .
This would make the prize more inconsiderable if it was called " $ 65,000 total prize winnings " to all the viewers .
You discuss many horrible housing situations during your reign as Top Model .
Were you not allowed to make your own decisions as far as housing was concerned ?
In the beginning , no .
My parents and I were told where I would stay , and what I could and mostly could not bring .
The second housing was because I refused to live in the first dwelling and again this was an arranged accommodation .

After seeing how nasty this second place was ( mice in my bed ) , I decided to make a decision and see what I could afford in terms of rent close to what I was already paying ( $ 650 ) in another place in Toronto [ that was ] NOT in someone 's house .
This is where I found [ the final place ] , the only available place for this price ... a place on Parliament Street .
The nasty side of town .

Your spread in
Fashion
magazine only paid $ 500 .
Is that a competitive rate for models or do you feel that you were paid less because you were under your television contract ?

That is incorrect ; I was paid zero dollars for the
Fashion
shoot .
I was paid $ 500 for a wedding magazine front page and spread .
This dollar amount is standard in the business for this job - apparently whether you are Canada 's Next Top Model or not .
Why do you feel CityTV did not back you , as you say they were going to , during the lawsuit with your previous agency ?
The truth ?
We never got them to sign on their promises to my parents and I. They knew this and we were naive and did n't .
Everything these days is officialized only if it is in writing .
So , they claim now that they never said such things and [ told us ] to deal with the situation as these things happen every day .
The Canadian website

Canoe said you had alleged that
Jeanne Beker
, a judge on the show , effectively " ruined your career .
" Can you elaborate on what was meant by that , and do you indeed feel she ruined your career ?
